intro: Diacalpe manchuriensis, commonly known as the Manchurian diacalpe, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
